\n This stream is currently <: This stream is currently a public stream which means anyone in the organization can join it. Making it private will mean that only the invited members can join and access its content. Members of the stream can invite others.

This stream is currently an invite-only stream which means only invited members can join and access its content. Making it public will make it possible for anyone in your organization to join and access it.
\n <b>Streams</b> are like chat r: Kanalen zijn als chat rooms of distributielijsten. Je kunt eraan meedoen, ze verlaten, en ze maken.
\n <p class=\"api-key-note\">For: For most bots using the API, you'll want to give each bot its own name and API key using the above section. But if you want to write a bot that can access your own private messages, you should use your personal API key.
\n The <b>topic</b> of a conversa: The topic of a conversation is one or two words that describe what it is about, for example: Bug #345, lunch, or logo. Don't overthink it.
\n <p>Please re-enter your password: Voer nogmaals je wachtwoord in om je identiteit te bevestigen. (Vergeten?)

Lets everyone know about the new stream,
even if you don't add them.
\n <p>You can <b>narrow</b> to a stre: Je kunt beperken tot een kanaal of onderwerp door erop te klikken, of in keer op je startpagina alle berichten van alle kanalen zien.

Add extra emoji for members of the __rea: Extra emoji toevoegen voor leden van de __realm_name__ organisatie.
Alert words allow you to be notified as: Alert words allow you to be notified as if you were @-mentioned when certain words or phrases are used in Zulip.
Always auto-scroll to new messages: Altijd automatisch doorbladeren naar nieuwe berichten

If checked, only users with an e-mail ad: If checked, only users with an e-mail address ending in these domains will be able to join the organization.

If non-zero, users can edit their messag: If non-zero, users can edit their message for this many minutes after it is sent. If zero, users can edit all their past messages.
